text: Harvard and IBM signed an agreement to build the Mark I, also known as the IBM Automatic Sequence Controlled Calculator (ASCC). It weighed 5 tons and read data from paper tape and punch cards.
Richard Depew accidentally posted 200 identical messages to news.admin.policy while testing some auto-moderation software. It became the first USENET postings to be referred to as spam.
After three years of development and much wrangling with the Warcraft engine it was originally built on, Blizzard released the iconic game Starcraft.
IBM shut down the Roadrunner supercomputer, the first computer to run at more than one petaflop.
